attributes.action: Government to immediately legislate that  visitors to UK  have Health Insurance
attributes.background: The NHS is a great institution, and unfortunately is now in dire straits. Health tourists  are taking advantage of a system that is not fit for purpose.  On arrival into the country  medical insurance must be provided with immediate effect.

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid to help fund Social Care instead of increasing Council Tax
attributes.background: The Government are seeking to increase Council Tax as a way of funding the gap in Social Care Funding. We believe that instead of further taxing already struggling families the foreign aid budget should be cut and the money saved to be used instead.
attributes.additional_details: In her maiden speech the Prime Minister stated she would be working for all those people who were just about managing. Let her prove it by listening to the people.

attributes.action: Embed Armed Forces Covenant into law in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces Covenant 2015 is a promise from the Nation to those who serve or have served in The Armed Forces and their Families to be treated fairly and should suffer no disadvantage due to their service. This promise is not being upheld Nationwide , the only recourse is for it to be made Law
attributes.additional_details: The Armed Forces Covenant has much to offer  Serving & Veterans of HMF unfortunately upholding the Covenant across United Kingdom is very inconsistent to the point in some areas of the Country it is not even acknowledged by local Government,NHS, ect causing some Veterans to become homeless and many others to continue to suffer injuries both physical & mental without adequate help or treatment at the moment enforcement of the Armed Forces Covenant is optional not Law a `promise` is not working .

attributes.action: Block the affiliation fee increase of 1150% for rifle clubs and museums
attributes.background:
The home office is running a review of affiliation fees for rifle clubs and museums holding section 5 firearms.
The fee is currently £84, under the new proposal the fee would increase to £1050; an increase of 1150%.
This would have a massive impact on the 38 museums and 61 clubs requiring this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government have made it an arduous process to respond, requiring a lengthy form to be downloaded, filled, and emailed back. This is likely to significantly reduce the amount of signatories opposed to this proposition.
The official review is here: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/583035/170110pn_Firearms_Fees_consultation_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Make the NHS pay for Bone Marrow Transplant For Adult Sickle Cell Patients
attributes.background: Bone marrow transplant offers a cure for some sickle cells patients, while children have access to this treatment under the NHS, adults do not, even though medical advances have made it a clinically safe procedure with an 85% success rate, in sickle cell adult patients treated in Europe and USA
attributes.additional_details: If the evidence exists internationally that patients could be cured of this disorder with a bone marrow transplant, there is a sense that UK sickle adult patients experience health inequalities around their treatment options and this contradicts NHS values. A successful bone marrow transplant means patients not enduring painful crises or recurrent hospitalisation. This saves the NHS money in the long run, enabling patients to lead healthy productive lives, and not being held hostage by illness

attributes.action: Immediate General Election if Article 50 not triggered before April 2017
attributes.background: By April 2017, the British People will have waited 9 months since the Referendum result for Article 50 to be triggered. Not doing so in this time shows disrespect for the British Voters, therefore signatures on this petition have no confidence in the British Government and demand a General Election

attributes.action: Save Remembrance Sunday Parades.
attributes.background: Due to a change in policy roads can no longer be closed. Unless local communities contract a road traffic management company to close the roads at a cost of thousands of pounds. Government should provide the council or police with extra money for these events to take place. Or these events will STOP
attributes.additional_details: local communities are devastated that their local parade or remembrance Sunday service being lost forever. The council do not have the funds for these event to take place. The police can no longer close roads due to a change in policy. Soldier's, have died in 2 world wars and various other conflict since, we need to ensure they are remembered in a fitting manner. These parades need to be saved for future generations so they understand the ultimate sacrifice that was made by these men and woman.

attributes.action: Don't remove children from victims of domestic violence
attributes.background: Some victims of domestic violence have their children taken away from them when they report the abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Don't remove children from victims. Victims of domestic abuse should not be made to suffer more than they have already by having their children taken away from them, as long as their children can be protected from abuse.

attributes.action: Government to prevent local councils cease funds to maintain bowling facilities
attributes.background: Britain has an ageing population. Withdrawing funding will result in older and vulnerable people in our society becoming less mobile and lose their only social contact.  We want our national government to step in to prevent the destruction of this valuable sporting and recreational facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Many local councils are planning to withdraw funding to maintain bowling greens.  This short sighted action will have a knock on effect of less mobile, less fit elderly people.  The consequences are an increased demand on NHS and care facilities.

http://www.thetelegraphandargus.co.uk/news/15039978.Bowling_clubs__under_threat__from_Bradford_Council_cutbacks/

attributes.action: Stop all refugees to the UK.
attributes.background: This only encourages more to come, we already have enough issues with looking after our own people.  Help should be focused in the closest safe country.

attributes.action: Stop a race to the bottom on corporation tax
attributes.background: The Conservative government has suggested that if we do not get sufficient access to the single market when the UK leaves the EU, the UK would be forced to lower corporate tax rates to attract business to Britain. This is not the future we want for our country.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that corporations should pay their fair share of tax to fund the infrastructure and public services we all depend on. We further believe that to achieve this, there must be cooperation between nation states on tax matters. 
 
We deplore any attempt to encourage tax competition and to foster a race to the bottom on corporate tax rates putting at risk the social investment that citizens rely on.
 
We call on the government to work cooperatively with our EU partners on harmonising corporate tax rates across Europe and to ensure that the main rate of UK corporation tax rate is returned to a minimum of 28%.

attributes.action: Save St Albans Pubs! Reduce proposed 2017 Business Rates before it is too late
attributes.background: The average increase to affected pubs is 72% (over £27000 per pub). This is an unaffordable increase that will lead to severe job losses and pub closures. We are urging the Government to give additional rate relief to local authorities to ensure the protection of our community asset, the local pub.
attributes.additional_details: St Albans has one of the most famous pub scenes in the world and the pub scene is wrapped in our local history. We are the home of CAMRA and home to the oldest pub in the country. Pubs not only employ local people, they are a community hub providing a meeting place, local entertainment and support our local farmers and suppliers. We are also a huge supporter of local charities. If these rate increases go ahead we will lose our independent pubs and will destroy a huge part of our history.

attributes.action:
Police crackdown on motorcycle thefts in the UK.
Authorise police more powers.
attributes.background:
Motorcycle thefts are at a record breaking high and will continue to rise unless something is done about it.
Enable police more powers & resources to catch motorcycle thieves.

attributes.action: Provide Devon Education Authorities with the National Average for Pupil Funding
attributes.background: For many years Devon has been one of the lowest-funded education authorities in England. In 2016-17 this resulted in a shortfall of £290 per pupil when compared to the national average. Other schools are funded at much higher than the national average and who therefore receive considerably more.
attributes.additional_details:
Just before Christmas the DfE announced the Stage 2 Consultation of this promised national funding formula for schools. We had hoped that this announcement would bring about a readjustment in funding that would benefit Uffculme School given our historic underfunding. We are shocked and dismayed to find out that the result of this for Uffculme is a 2.8% decrease in our funding by 2019-20. This means that our budget will be reduced by £140,000. 

Help Devon Schools by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Fund health and psychological care for survivors of FGM
attributes.background: The NHS is providing inadequate services to FGM survivors, e.g. funding for the award-winning Acton clinic that has helped thousands for nearly a decade is ending. Government must provide funding to ensure services remain and are provided away from hospitals as many fear repercussions and stigma.
attributes.additional_details: It is important for non-pregnant and woman under 25 to have access to a discrete and holistic service which will enable them to take the first steps to recovery from this most serious form of abuse.  These are the women who will end FGM if we support them now. Providing support at an earlier stage will prevent more serious physical and psychological issues and promotes efficiency in healthcare provision.
attributes.creator_name: Diaspora Matters: Jay K. Frederick, Janet Fyle MBE, Leyla Hussain, Neelam Sarkaria

attributes.action: Investigate Bayer & Baxter in relation to HIV-infected Factor VIII in the NHS
attributes.background: During the 1980's both Bayer AG and Baxter (Travenol) sold HIV infected Factor Concentrates, which were purchased by the UK Government and the NHS. Their actions have not been investigated by Westminster, not even a refund has been sought. We believe victims and their families deserve the truth.
attributes.additional_details:
1,243 Haemophiliacs were infected with HIV from using contaminated Factor products. Less than 250 remain alive.

Tainted Blood Scandal - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tainted_blood_scandal_(United_Kingdom)

attributes.action: Let us UK citizens live in the UK with our own wives and husbands.
attributes.background: This petition might seem strange at first, but the family visa rules introduced by Theresa May in 2012 see countless British Citizens live in forced separation from their partners, or in exile. The Supreme Court found parts of the rules 'lawful' but that doesn't make them right. Please change them.
attributes.additional_details:
"Please, Theresa May, relax the rules for spouse visas..." - Telegraph article, July 2016 http://bit.ly/pleasetheresa 

"When people's love is divided by the law, it is the law that needs to change" - then Prime Minister David Cameron, 2014 http://bit.ly/thelawthatneedstochange 

"We are proud that here in the UK we are all free to be with whoever we fall in love with" - official Twitter account of the department for Women and Equalities, Valentines Day 2017 http://bit.ly/ukpride

attributes.action: Reverse restrictions on housing element of Universal Credit for 18-21 yr olds
attributes.background: On 3rd March the government introduced new legislation which restricts 18-21 year olds from claiming the housing element of Universal Credit (Housing Benefit). This will leave thousands of young people who do not have the support of their families at serious risk of homelessness.
attributes.additional_details:
Research shows that 9,000 young people could be put at risk of homelessness, and will face the choice of living on the streets or living in unsafe and unsuitable accommodation. 
Research by Herriot Watt University shows that the legislation will save the Government just £3.3 million, and that even these savings will be eroded if just 140 young people were made homeless as a result of the policy.

attributes.action: Re-open Trafford General Hospital as a fully operational Hospital and A&E again.
attributes.background: Trafford General Hospital served south Manchester for decades, a couple of years ago the A&E was closed and since then residents in this region need to go elseware. After a personal experience the A&E at the MRI is overworked and understaffed. Re-open Trafford General as a fully staffed A&E/Hospital
attributes.additional_details: Trafford General is the Birth place of the NHS, I went back to the 'hospital' a few days ago and it's just such a shame, entire wards are closed off and in darkness.  The infestruction, the wards, operating theatres, the buildings etc it's all there going to waste, it could be fully staffed and up and running again in no time at all....  The NHS could certainly do with another hospital in this time of crisis and we have this place just going to waste.

attributes.action: Make Cystic Fibrosis a qualifying condition on the prescription exemption list.
attributes.background: People with Cystic Fibrosis often take 50+ tablets a day just to help them breathe and digest food. It's a life debilitating condition with an average life expectancy of 41, yet Cystic Fibrosis is still not seen serious enough to add it to the medical exemption list. Help us help those with CF!
attributes.additional_details: 11,000 people in the UK have Cystic Fibrosis. It's caused by a faulty gene which affects the movement of salt and water in and out of cells. People with Cystic Fibrosis experience a build-up of thick sticky mucus in the lungs, digestive system and other organs, causing a wide range of challenging symptoms affecting the whole body. It causes chronic infections often requiring weeks of isolated hospital stays, and many people may eventually need lung transplants. https://www.cysticfibrosis.org.uk/

attributes.action: Overturn the decision to sell off Preston's historic Fulwood Barracks.
attributes.background: The decision to announce the end of the home of the Duke of Lancaster's regiment as part of the biggest sell-offs of military land any Government has ever announced has been met with shock, surprise and anger by the people of Lancashire.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.lep.co.uk/your-lancashire/preston/fulwood-barracks-to-close-in-shock-mod-move-1-8224299
The Grade II listed building has been home of the Queen's Lancashire Regiment for nearly 150 years and now houses four Infantry battalions. It also houses the popular Lancashire Infantry Museum, the largest Regimental archive in the north of England.
The Barracks is an important part of the history and culture of Preston and it is a vital link between the local regiment and the population.

attributes.action: Lower the age to 20 for women to have smear tests.
attributes.background: After today, reading of another young mum dying of cervical cancer because she was to young to have a smear test I decided to start this petition so we can fight for a change in the age that smears are routinely offered. I believe at the very least the age should be lowered to 20.

attributes.action: Let airport staff carry liquids over 100ml through staff security & test liquid.
attributes.background: For ages now cabin crew and airport staff in UK cannot carry liquid over 100ml through the airport security but anywhere else outside the UK can. All they need to do is test the liquid at the staff security. Many unhappy staff spending a fortune or going without drinks.
attributes.additional_details: In France they do liquid tests on cokes or wines or anything taken through. Other European countried they dont do the test atal and trust their staff.

attributes.action: Re-evaluate the laws surrounding dog attacks on horses and their riders
attributes.background:
On the 15th of February 2017 two horses and a rider were viciously attacked by a Staffordshire Bull Terrier, causing one of the horses to undergo 6.5 hours of veterinary attention due to the severity of its wounds. 
One rider was also bitten, casing deep muscle damage to her right calf.
attributes.additional_details: The police informed the riders that no criminal offence had been committed, as it was deemed that the dog was not behaving dangerously before it attacked, and that there was no way of knowing if the dog intended to bite the rider - making it impossible to determine if this was an animal on animal attack or an animal on human attack. This petition aims to bring attention to the need to tighten the laws surrounding dog attacks on horses to lessen the ambiguity surrounding animal on animal attacks

attributes.action: Make the video recording of PIP and ESA assessments mandatory.
attributes.background: Many PIP and ESA claims are being rejected by the DWP due to errors being made by assessors in their reporting of face-to-face assessments. A video recording of the assessment would assist claimants,the DWP and appeals panels by giving an indisputable record of the assessment.
attributes.additional_details: The DWP rely on assessors supplying accurate reports of PIP and ESA face-to-face assessments,many reports contain errors and false or inaccurate statements of events.This leads the DWP to reject a claim or make lower awards than the claimant is entitled to. A claimant may then have to request a mandatory reconsideration or appeal. A video recording of the assessment could help stop errors and would provide a point of reference to DWP staff and appeals panels.

attributes.action: All foreign prisoners to be deported, no return, send their families with them.
attributes.background: Create more placements in UK prisons by deporting foreign prisoners and their families, therefore reducing running costs, let their countries take responsibility for their people (with exceptions covered in additional details)
attributes.additional_details: Cost of UK prisons would be a lot less, deport foreign prisoners who should not responsibility of UK government, would create more places in UK prisons, let their governments put them in institutions, it's fair that their governments take responsibility for their people, exclusions from this ruling, example, terrorist governments may decide to free prisoners, overall should be a lot of prisoners that fit the bill without returning to the UK and without repercussions.

attributes.action: Continue to allow reciprocal freedom of movement with EU member states
attributes.background: Freedom of movement has been a fact of life for Brits and Europeans for many years. It's a vital source of economic & social mobility for individuals, and one which benefits UK businesses & cuts red tape. Future generations should not be deprived of this right.

attributes.action: Make political claims subject to advertising standards laws.
attributes.background: A company making false claims in order to sell its products is liable to prosecution. Any politician, candidate or political party making false claims should also be prosecuted.

attributes.action: Create a New Holiday in the Public Holiday Calendar to Celebrate Great Britain
attributes.background: In Britain we don't celebrate our country, in fact we have been taught that if we do we are inward looking nationalists being fanatical. This is utterly wrong. We need just one day in the year in which we can celebrate our culture, history, values and national character. We need a Great Britain Day.

attributes.action: Use the Foreign Aid budget to reimburse NHS costs for treating foreign nationals
attributes.background: The NHS is under severe financial strain and the Red Cross have described it as a humanitarian disaster. The Foreign Aid budget should provide aid in the form of health care to foreign nationals visiting, applying to become a UK citizen or seeking asylum. This can be done via a reimbursement scheme
attributes.additional_details: All health care services provided to government run asylum hostels or other such establishments; 'health tourists' such as pregnant women arriving deliberately to have their babies in the UK or who may be suffering chronic disease and have no treatment available in their home country should be declared 'distressed foreigners' & a simple application to Foreign Aid by any hospital clinic or GP Practice who treats a foreign national can claim back the cost directly to their own budget from the fund

attributes.action: Government must halt proposed changes to PIP
attributes.background: many thousands  are  deeply concerned by the Government’s proposed new regulations for the disability benefit Personal Independence Payment (PIP). This is a vital benefit for many disabled adults, helping them meet the additional costs of living with their disability.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposals would change the descriptors (the things PIP claimants have to prove are problems for them) so that:
in the Mobility component, some aspects of “planning and following a journey” would no longer include situations that cause the individual “overwhelming psychological distress”
in the Daily Living component of PIP, some people who take medication to manage their condition may not be eligible any more. 
There is more information about the proposals on the BBC News website

attributes.action: Stop vaccination with the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in our schools.
attributes.background: There is parental concern about the use of the Influenza Nasal Spray Vaccine in schools. There may be a risk of inhalation of the GM viral particles to those not consenting and evidence shows that recently vaccinated children may transmit the vaccine influenza strain to others in their community.
attributes.additional_details: If it is true that non consenting children are exposed to the GM viral particles or to the vaccine strains of influenza in school, the Nasal Spray Flu Vaccine Programme would appear to directly contradict the Secretary of State’s declaration in The Health Protection (Vaccination) Regulations 2009. This states that 'there is no provision for imposing or enabling any restriction or requirement which has, or would have, a significant effect on a person’s rights'.

attributes.action: Extend London weighting for student maintenance loans
attributes.background: High rents don’t stop at the M25. London weighting is based on an archaic view of student funding, where students in a defined geographical area are granted more than those who are not, regardless of living costs in the area of study.
attributes.additional_details: In the county of Surrey, a student studying in Egham will have access to over £2,000 per annum more in maintenance loans than a student studying in Guildford. Students round the fringes of London weighting are suffering the same problem where the London housing market has pushed up rents, but the student finance system has not kept pace.

attributes.action: Ban ALL antifreeze preparations unless they contain a bitterant
attributes.background: Antifreeze products like screen wash contain Ethylene Glycol that is highly toxic and kills 1000's of pets each year.  A teaspoon is enough to kill a cat, a tablespoon a dog.  Adding a bittering agent to ALL products would take away the sweet taste and discourage animals from licking any spills.

attributes.action: Keep off road motorsports vehicles exempt from compulsory insurance rules
attributes.background: The "Vnuk" ruling made by the European Court of Justice said that compulsory motor insurance should apply to any vehicle being used anywhere, for any purpose for which it was intended.
attributes.additional_details: The EU are looking at changing the current rules at the moment as a result of this judgement. The UK Government must do all it can to prevent off road motorsports from being affected.

attributes.action: Stop the SIA charging £220 for officers to renew their licence.
attributes.background: Why should the Security Industry Authority charge people every three years £220 to renew their licence and an additional £110 for any other licences held. People should not have to pay this amount of money to be able to go to work.
attributes.additional_details:
The security profession is overlooked by this country and most employees are on minimum wage.
We should not have to pay to work, the government should fund this organisation and not the employees. 
Without security officers the country would be nowhere near as safe as it is and we should be treated fairly.
This charge is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Make student loans available to Diploma Performing Arts students.
attributes.background: If you've chosen to go to University or Performing Arts College to study a Degree you are able to get a Student Loan. However, if you study a Diploma you are not able to gain a Student Loan however the prices are the same. Performers are struggling or not able to train due to no available funds.
attributes.additional_details: Performing Arts College courses last 3 years, the same as Universities. At 18 Careers Loan is available. However, this loan is only available for 2 years and once you have finished your training you need to start paying it back immediately. This isn't ideal for a new graduate who is trying to save as much money as they can to start their career. By having the student loan it can help throughout the whole 3 year course and gives the graduate time to start their career before paying it back.

attributes.action: Increase funding for ME/CFS research.
attributes.background: At the moment ME/CFS is diagnosed by ruling out every other illness. Doesn't sound right does it! If you think it's full name Myalgic Encephalomyelitis hard to pronounce, living with it is even harder.

attributes.action: Recognise the state of Palestine now alongside Israel 100 years on from Balfour
attributes.background: Our Government should recognise a state of Palestine now giving practical effect to British Policy of two states, Palestine and Israel, to live side by side in peace and security enabling Palestinians and Israelis to fulfil their right to self-determination, 100 years from the Balfour Declaration
attributes.additional_details: Palestine is recognised by over 130 countries worldwide. The United Kingdom, a permanent member of the UN Security Council,  should now do so as a major contribution to a two state solution to this conflict. While our Government recognised Israel in 1950, it has still not recognised Palestine – despite supporting many United Nations resolutions, and European Council conclusions confirming the Palestinian right to self-determination. This is in our National interest and that of the region

attributes.action: Sensory processing disorder should be recognised by the NHS as a disability
attributes.background: Sensory processing disorder is a condition in which the brain has trouble receiving and responding to information that comes in through the senses. Formerly referred to as sensory integration dysfunction, it is not currently recognized a a distinct medical diagnosis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.webmd.com/children/sensory-processing-disorder

If you’re familiar with the term “sensory overload,” you have an idea what sensory processing issues are. Sometimes called sensory processing disorder or SPD, these issues happen because the brain has trouble organizing information from the senses.

Children with sensory processing issues can be oversensitive to sights, sounds, textures, flavors, smells and other sensory input. This can make a trip to a toy store or trying a new dish at a restaurant an overwhelming experience for them. Other children with sensory processing issues are undersensitive to information they receive through the senses. This can lead to other problems.

attributes.action: stop all uk payments of foreign aid & all further payments to the EU immediately
attributes.background: The UK government to cease immediately any & all payments made to the EU regarding membership & stop all foreign aid payments until such time that our own NHS is back to where it should be & can look after people who are sick in this country,
attributes.additional_details:
, The elderly can retire like the ones in the past did at a reasonable age so that they can enjoy their final years & not have to work till they die & finally make sure our disabled people have what they need to live & not be told that they have to work even though they cannot!!
Billions going out from the Btitish peoples pocket to the EU & in foreign aid
Top lawyer said we owe the EU nothing

attributes.action: Create a new cabinet post  'Animal Welfare Secretary'
attributes.background: The general public and a growing number of MPs want to see vast improvement in the welfare of domestic, farm and wild animals in the UK and for animals to have a compassionate voice in parliament.
attributes.additional_details: Responsibilities could include the desire to 'end long distance live animal exports', 'end caged hens and farrowing crates for pigs', 'introduce better meat labelling', 'have CCTV in all slaughterhouses', 'phase out non stun slaughter', 'have scientific evidence-based debate on badger culling and driven grouse shooting', 'strengthen the ban on hunting with hounds', 'prevent dog fighting and badger baiting and ensure higher prison sentences for perpetrators', 'ban indiscriminate snares' etc.

attributes.action: Repeal legislation obliging Government to give-away 0.7% of GDP in overseas aid.
attributes.background: Current legislation obliging UK governments to give away 0.7% of GDP in overseas aid should be repealed; enabling future governments to determine levels of overseas aid commensurate with the then prevailing economic position of the UK and competing demands in welfare support of British citizens.

attributes.action: Keep the E-Bluey link in the UK military!
attributes.background: It has been announced that e-blueys are going to be cut on March 31st as a money saving scheme. Military children and families love writing to their parents serving abroad, the people that have decided to cut this service have no idea how much it means to receive the letters when we are away.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help keep the ebluey link going. There are still people serving on the front line, and the morale a simple letter can bring is so important. Yes, we now have smart phones etc, but the destinations intended for eblueys aren't destinations you would always want to use your phone. The morale of a simple letter from home isn't to be underestimated.

attributes.action: Participate in the UN conference to negotiate a Treaty to ban nuclear weapons.
attributes.background: The conference, which is set to take place in New York with the first session in March 2017, represents a significant opportunity to make real progress towards a worldwide nuclear weapons ban.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst repeatedly claiming to support multilateral nuclear disarmament, successive governments appear to have done very little towards actually bringing it about. The forthcoming United Nations conference is an opportunity for this government to send out a message globally that it is serious about achieving a world free of nuclear weapons.

attributes.action: Help disabled people to work by abolishing the cap on Access to Work payments
attributes.background: The Access to Work Scheme helps disabled people to work by paying for the extra costs they face. In April 2018, the Government is planning to impose an arbitrary cap on how much money a person can claim. This will make it far harder for disabled people to find and keep a job.
attributes.additional_details: ATW enables disabled people to work by paying for equipment, PAs or extra travel costs. From April 2018, people will not be able to claim over £40,800 a year. This cap will only save £3 million but make it almost impossible for severely disabled people to work and cause huge distress. It contradicts the Government’s aim to increase the number of disabled people with jobs. It also does not make economic sense. For every £1 spent on ATW, £1.48 returns to the Exchequer in tax or benefits savings.

attributes.action: We want MP's to vote in favour of giving the people the final vote on brexit.
attributes.background:
On 22/3/17 Tim Farron introduced a bill to give the British people the final say on Brexit once the negotiations are done and we know the full implications of what will happen. 
This petition is for the British people to show their support of this bill prior to the vote in Parliament on May 12th.
attributes.additional_details:
This bill gives us all the chance to vote on the reality of Brexit once Theresa May has concluded her negotiations.There is already a precedent for this. Ireland, where given two referendums on the Lisbon treaty, Once further information and amendments were made.

We want parliament to know that the British people support this bill and urge them to vote in favour of it. 
Two years is a very long time and we need to make sure that the will of the government still matches the will of the people.

attributes.action: End Benefit Sanctions and the Work Capability Assessment.
attributes.background: Sanctions and Work Capability Assessments are unfair, disproportionate and cruel. They are leading to the deaths of our citizens, causing suicides, mental health issues and increasing the involvement of the police, hospitals and social services. WCAs regularly overrule medical professionals advice.
attributes.additional_details:
The PCS union have presented evidence to MPs that show that sanction rates are monitored at the level of the adviser, the team, the office and the district, and that some individual managers take action with their staff if sanction rates are “too low”.

The sanctions regime now also affects an increasing number of Employment and Support Allowance (ESA) claimants – who are too ill or disabled to work currently, but whom the DWP consider will be capable of work at some time in the future.

attributes.action: Guarantee the survival of the Urgent Care Centre at K&C Hospital
attributes.background:
If Kent and Canterbury Hospital urgent care centre closed it would potentially signal the end of its life as an acute hospital.
The urgent care centre treats patients with acute medical illnesses, such as heart attacks or strokes.
attributes.additional_details:
“For patients this means even longer waiting time in A&E, either at Ashford or Thanet.”
Changes to hospital services are being carried out amid a chaotic winter period which has seen patients lying on beds in corridors and the trust regularly breaches the four-hour target for waiting times.
Canterbury is a city which has over 150000 residents and we need a fully functioning hospital. We have already lost our A+E department and if we lose our urgent care centre then lives will be lost.

attributes.action:
Mandatory training in education 
re impact of abuse/trauma on children
attributes.background: Children who no longer remain with birth families often have attachment difficulties & a history of witnessing/experiencing abusive trauma regardless of the age they were removed, this is rarely understood by teachers or school staff. This needs to alter to increase attainment levels for children
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidelines advise that schools ought to complete training regarding attachment, brain development & the impact of trauma/abuse on these, but currently most schools (primary & secondary) appear to struggle with understanding the needs of children who are no longer with birth families. This ultimately impacts negatively on these children's attainment & enjoyment of school.  We wish to make it mandatory for teachers to undergo training regarding the impact of trauma on brain development & attachment. Training should also be reviewed in order to ensure all teaching staff understand these children's needs.  Work by John Bowlby, Margaret Ainsworth, Dan Hughes, Bruce Perry, & Graham Music all provide detail about brain development, trauma & attachment.
